SEARCH
Package com.cestar.controllers

Class Controller

java.lang.Object
jakarta.servlet.GenericServlet
jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServlet
com.cestar.controllers.Controller
All Implemented Interfaces:
jakarta.servlet.Servlet, jakarta.servlet.ServletConfig, Serializable
@WebServlet("/") public class Controller extends jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServlet
The Controller class handles HTTP requests and manages the user authentication and creation process. It extends HttpServlet and provides methods for handling GET and POST requests.
See Also:

  • Method Details

    • doGet

      protected void doGet(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws jakarta.servlet.ServletException, IOException
      Handles GET requests. Depending on the URL, it forwards the request to the appropriate method for user creation or login.
      Overrides:
      doGet in class jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServlet
      Parameters:
      request - the HttpServletRequest object that contains the request the client made of the servlet
      response - the HttpServletResponse object that contains the response the servlet returns to the client
      Throws:
      jakarta.servlet.ServletException - if an error occurs that interferes with the servlet's normal operation
      IOException - if an input or output error occurs while the servlet is handling the GET request

    • doPost

      protected void doPost(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws jakarta.servlet.ServletException, IOException
      Handles POST requests by delegating to the doGet method.
      Overrides:
      doPost in class jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServlet
      Parameters:

      response - the HttpServletResponse object that contains the response the servlet returns to the client
      Throws:

      IOException - if an input or output error occurs while the servlet is handling the POST request

    • login

      protected void login(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws jakarta.servlet.ServletException, IOException
      Authenticates the user based on the provided credentials. If successful, the user is redirected to the display page; otherwise, an error message is set and the user is redirected back to the index page.
      Parameters:
      request - the HttpServletRequest object that contains the request the client made of the servlet
      response - the HttpServletResponse object that contains the response the servlet returns to the client
      Throws:
      jakarta.servlet.ServletException - if an error occurs that interferes with the servlet's normal operation
      IOException - if an input or output error occurs while the servlet is handling the login request

    • create

      protected void create(jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request, jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletResponse response) throws jakarta.servlet.ServletException, IOException
      Creates a new user based on the information provided in the request. If the user is created successfully, a success message is displayed; if the username is already registered or another error occurs, an appropriate error message is displayed.
      Parameters:
      request - the HttpServletRequest object that contains the request the client made of the servlet
      response - the HttpServletResponse object that contains the response the servlet returns to the client
      Throws:
      jakarta.servlet.ServletException - if an error occurs that interferes with the servlet's normal operation
      IOException - if an input or output error occurs while the servlet is handling the create request
